content: The Avatar component is used to represent a user. It displays an image from a `src`. If the image fails to load, it falls back to showing initials generated from the `name` prop, or a default icon. A custom fallback can also be provided.
The `AvatarGroup` component is used to display a group of avatars. You can limit the number of visible avatars with the `max` prop, and it will render a count for the remaining ones.

Avatars can be styled with props like `color`, `radius`, `size`, and `isBordered`. For more granular control, use the `classNames` prop to style individual slots like `base`, `img`, `fallback`, `name`, and `icon`.
For advanced cases, you can use the `useAvatar` hook to build a completely custom implementation. The logic for generating initials can also be customized with the `getInitials` prop.
